# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * ' '
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(join(wrapped_text, "\n"))
```

Output:

```
This is a very
long string that
needs to be
wrapped into
multiple lines.
```
